title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Campitelli E (2025). gadiera5: Retrieves ERA5 files gadi replication. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://eliocamp.github.io/gadiera5/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gadiera5: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication},   author = {Elio Campitelli},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://eliocamp.github.io/gadiera5/}, }

what: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication
title: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication
text: goal gadiera5 list ERA5 files stored gadi.

title: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication
text: can install development version gadiera5 like :

title: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication
text: era5() function main entry point. returns data.table information available variables aggregation level, well description. data.table can filtered subsetted usual. set_date_range() function sets dates dates interest. range can specified full dates setting year-month just year also supported. Finally, use get_files() retrieve files. return data.table list column called files.
code: library(gadiera5)  (temp_2metres <- era5() |>   _[variable == "2t" & aggregation == "monthly-averaged"]) #>    variable           long_name         level      aggregation #>      <char>              <char>        <char>           <char> #> 1:       2t 2 metre temperature single-levels monthly-averaged temp_2metres |>   set_date_range(c("2020-01-03", "2022-03-15")) #>    variable           long_name         level      aggregation range_start #>      <char>              <char>        <char>           <char>      <Date> #> 1:       2t 2 metre temperature single-levels monthly-averaged  2020-01-03 #>     range_end #>        <Date> #> 1: 2022-03-15 temp_2metres |>   set_date_range(c("2020-01", "2022-03")) #>    variable           long_name         level      aggregation range_start #>      <char>              <char>        <char>           <char>      <Date> #> 1:       2t 2 metre temperature single-levels monthly-averaged  2020-01-01 #>     range_end #>        <Date> #> 1: 2022-03-31 (temp_2metres <- temp_2metres |>   set_date_range(c(2020, 2022))) #>    variable           long_name         level      aggregation range_start #>      <char>              <char>        <char>           <char>      <Date> #> 1:       2t 2 metre temperature single-levels monthly-averaged  2020-01-01 #>     range_end #>        <Date> #> 1: 2022-12-31 temp_2metres |>   get_files() #>    variable      aggregation range_start  range_end           files #>      <char>           <char>      <Date>     <Date> <list_of_files> #> 1:       2t monthly-averaged  2020-01-01 2022-12-31      <36 files>

title: Get ERA5 data catalogue — era5
text: Returns catalogue available ERA5 reanalysis data gadi. catalogue contains information available variables, temporal aggregations (hourly monthly), vertical levels (single-level pressure-level).

title: Get ERA5 data catalogue — era5
Get ERA5 data catalogue — era5
text: data.table following columns: variable: ERA5 variable short name (e.g., "2t" 2-meter temperature) long_name: Descriptive name variable level: Vertical level type ("single-levels" "pressure-levels") aggregation: Temporal aggregation ("reanalysis" hourly, "monthly-averaged" monthly)

title: Get ERA5 data catalogue — era5
text: catalogue can filtered using standard data.table operations combined set_date_range() get_files() retrieve specific data files.

title: Get ERA5 data catalogue — era5
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get full catalogue catalogue <- era5()  # Filter for specific variable temp_data <- era5() |>   subset(variable == "2t")  # Search for variables using "geopotential" geopotential <- era5() |>   subset(grepl("geopotential", long_name, ignore.case = TRUE))  # Filter for monthly single-level data monthly_sfc <- era5() |>   subset(aggregation == "monthly-averaged" & level == "single-levels") } # }

what: gadiera5: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication — gadiera5-package
title: gadiera5: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication — gadiera5-package
gadiera5: Retrieves ERA5 files from gadi replication — gadiera5-package

what: Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
title: Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
text: function takes catalogue ERA5 data (typically obtained era5() filtered set_date_range()) returns corresponding file paths gadi's filesystem.

title: Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
text: catalogue data.table containing ERA5 catalogue information. Typically obtained subsetting output era5() applying set_date_range().

title: Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
text: data.table columns: variable: ERA5 variable name aggregation: temporal aggregation (e.g., "monthly", "hourly") range_start: Start date requested range range_end: End date requested range files: list column containing character vectors file paths combination variable, aggregation, date range. Files exist NA.

title: Get all the files defined by a catalogue — get_files
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get catalogue and filter for specific variable and dates catalogue <- era5() |>   subset(variable == "2t") |>   set_date_range("2020-01-01", "2020-12-31") |>   get_files(catalogue) } # }

what: Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
title: Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
text: Adds date range columns ERA5 catalogue filtering data files temporal extent. function typically used era5() get_files() specify desired time period data retrieval.

title: Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
text: catalogue data.table containing ERA5 catalogue information, typically obtained era5(). range date range specification. Can provided multiple formats: Date object POSIXct/POSIXlt datetime object (length 2 vector start end) character vector ISO format dates: c("2020-01-01", "2020-12-31") character vector year : c("2020", "2021") (automatically expands full year) character vector year-month: c("2020-01", "2020-06") (expands first/last day month)

title: Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
text: copy input catalogue two additional columns: range_start: Start date requested range (Date class) range_end: End date requested range (Date class)

title: Set a date range for an ERA5 catalogue — set_date_range
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set date range with full dates catalogue <- era5() |>   set_date_range(c("2020-01-01", "2020-12-31"))  # Set date range with years only catalogue <- era5() |>   set_date_range(c("2020", "2021"))  # Set date range with year-month catalogue <- era5() |>   set_date_range(c("2020-06", "2020-08"))  # Use Date objects catalogue <- era5() |>   set_date_range(c(as.Date("2020-01-01"), as.Date("2020-12-31"))) } # }
